alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 3:17PM MST until February 22 at 3:45PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... North central Mesa County in west central Colorado... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 316 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Palisade to near Grand Junction, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 31 and 60. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 34 and 50. Colorado 65 between mile markers 55 and 61. Colorado 141 between mile markers 139 and 162. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Palisade, De Beque, Cameo, Fruitvale, Clifton, Orchard Mesa and Whitewater. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
